intro: Spergularia media var. robertii, commonly known as the coastal sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to sandy coastal areas. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, pinkish flowers and succulent leaves. The plant thrives in well-drained, saline soils and is often found in dune habitats. It has a low-growing habit and produces capsules that contain numerous small seeds. This species is adapted to harsh coastal environments and plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes.
